revised_title: Ice-Shelf Investigations and Meteorology in Halley Bay, Antarctica
tldr: The article discusses the results of the Royal Society's expedition to Halley Bay, Antarctica, during the International Geophysical Year. It focuses on the ice-shelf's nature, accumulation measurements, and ice-hill investigations. The authors also briefly describe the ionospheric phenomena observed at Halley Bay and the influence of the Weddell Sea magnetic dip anomaly.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Glaciology and Climate Science
